string-array.name: faq_list
string-array.item: When is the Student Success Center open?
How can I get in contact with the Success Center?
Where is the Student Success Center located on campus?
Can I make an appointment for private one on one tutoring?
How many appointments can I make a week?
What do I need to do to receive tutoring at the Success Center?
Is there anything I need to bring with me for tutoring?
How can I set up a study group?

string-array.name: faq_details
string-array.item: The Success Center is open Monday through Thursday from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m., Friday 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. and Saturday from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. We are closed Sundays.
The best way for you to contact us is by phone at (714)432-5559.
We are located in the Classrooms and Labs building (C&L) 103 under the blue clock tower.
One on one tutoring is available for a variety of subjects and can be arranged by coming into the Success Center and setting up an appointment with the front desk.
Generally you can make one appointment a week unless you qualify for special assistance and get approval for additional help from your counselor.
In order to be tutored at the Success Center you must come into the center and sign up for Tutoring 050. The front desk staff will be able to guide you through the registration process.

You MUST have your Student ID in order to sign in for tutoring. We also request that you bring your book, syllabus, notes, and study materials as well as questions for the tutors and a ready to work attitude.

You can request a study group for any subject. In order to do so you must have at least 5 students willing to sign up and commit to attending a study session on a weekly basis. Sign-up sheets are located in folders organized by subject at the front desk of the Student Success center. Most study sessions are once a week for 50 minutes and new students are welcome to join an existing study group at any time.
